evidence_items.text: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug. The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so. The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin. The wingman was on the left just ahead of the tug.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.
The tug instructor pulled the aircraft forward off the fence then stopped the tug.

slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The root CS__R1_PUSHBACK_PROCEDURAL_DEVIATION__R3_ENVIRONMENT_OR_MARKING_DEFICIENCY demonstrates defeater resistance by accounting for potential counterarguments and ensuring robustness in identifying environment or marking deficiencies as causes of procedural deviations.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The root CS__R1_PUSHBACK_PROCEDURAL_DEVIATION__R3_ENVIRONMENT_OR_MARKING_DEFICIENCY fits the key features of the Boeing_737-8AS_9H-QAA_12-25:hist_composition_t1_early scope by addressing procedural deviations related to environment or marking deficiencies during pushback operations.

defeaters: If evidence showed the pushback deviation was solely due to communication breakdown without environmental or marking issues.

quotes.exact_quote: The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H4 directly describes the aircraft moving beyond the TRP ground markings and hitting a blast barrier, indicating an environment or marking deficiency, thus supporting availability of the root node CS__R1_PUSHBACK_PROCEDURAL_DEVIATION__R3_ENVIRONMENT_OR_MARKING_DEFICIENCY.

node.statement: The root CS__R1_PUSHBACK_PROCEDURAL_DEVIATION__R3_ENVIRONMENT_OR_MARKING_DEFICIENCY fits the key features of the Boeing_737-8AS_9H-QAA_12-25:hist_composition_t1_early scope by addressing procedural deviations related to environment or marking deficiencies during pushback operations.

defeaters: If evidence showed the deviation was caused primarily by communication failure rather than environment or marking deficiency
If the aircraft had not moved beyond the TRP or hit the blast barrier

quotes.exact_quote: The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

This discriminates against communication breakdown (H1-H3 do not indicate environment/marking issues).

If alternative explanations for the deviation were better supported by evidence
